articles.title: DPRK Premier Makes Field Survey of Hungnam Area
articles.content:
DPRK Premier Makes Field Survey of Hungnam Area 
						
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Pak Pong Ju made a field survey of the industrial field in Hungnam area. 
					 Going round the Hungnam Fertilizer Complex, the Ryongsong Machine Complex and the Hungnam Electrode Factory, he learnt in detail about the production there. 
					
					 Consultative meetings of officials concerned took place at the relevant units. 
					
					 The meetings discussed on the issues of properly setting the period of overhauling of equipment, cutting short it, ensuring technical features of custom-built equipment and raising the intensity of electrode in order to remove hurdles in the fertilizer production of the year. 
					
					 The meetings took measures calling on the coal mines related to the relevant units to build new coal dressing processes and focus efforts on earth scrapping and increase the production of raw materials for electrode. 
					
					 Meanwhile, the premier went round the Hamhung Branch of the State Academy of Sciences and the February 8 Vinalon Complex and discussed the issue of putting the vinalon production on normal footing.

articles.title: DPRK FM Meets Myanmar Delegation
articles.content:
DPRK FM Meets Myanmar Delegation
						
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Ri Su Yong met and had a talk with a delegation of the Foreign Ministry of Myanmar led by Deputy Minister Thant Kyaw who paid a courtesy call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Tuesday.

articles.title: Greetings to Nicaraguan FM
articles.content:
Greetings to Nicaraguan FM
						
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- Ri Su Yong, foreign minister of the DPRK, Tuesday sent a message of greeting to his Nicaraguan counterpart Samuel Santos Lopez on the occasion of the 194th anniversary of the independence of Nicaragua.
					 Expressing belief that the good friendly and cooperative relations between the governments and peoples of the two countries would grow stronger, the message wished the Nicaraguan foreign minister success in his responsible work.

articles.title: Message of Sympathy to Foreign Minister of Saudi Arabia
articles.content:
Message of Sympathy to Foreign Minister of Saudi Arabia 
						
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- Foreign Minister Ri Su Yong Monday sent a message of sympathy to Saud Al Faisal bin Abdul-Aziz, foreign minister of Saudi Arabia, in connection with the fact that an accident at a mosque in Mecca of the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia claimed big casualties.
					 The message expressed deep sympathy and consolation to the foreign minister and, through him, to the bereaved families of the victims and hoped the people of Saudi Arabia would overcome the grief and eradicate the aftermath of the disaster successfully.

articles.title: Reply Message to Kim Jong Un from Syrian President
articles.content:
Reply Message to Kim Jong Un from Syrian President
						
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a reply message from Bashar Al-Assad, president of the Syrian Arab Republic, on September 11.
					 The president in his message expressed deep thanks for Kim Jong Un's congratulations on the occasion of his 50th birthday.
					
					 The message went on:
					
					 I know well about the true sentiment and firm stand of Your Excellency supporting our people in their struggle against the outrageous war to infringe upon the sovereignty, independence and territorial integrity of the Syrian Arab Republic and the security of the people.
					
					 I feel grateful to Your Excellency for expressing conviction of the strength of our army and people to combat terrorism and hostile forces behind it and highly appreciate your noble stand of supporting our cause of justice and hoping that our country will overcome trials.
					
					 Availing myself of this opportunity, I express belief that the ties between the peoples of the two countries and our joint struggle for several decades will grow stronger. I assure you that we will continue to make joint efforts for developing the special relations between the two countries in the interests of the peoples of the two countries.
					
					 I wish Your Excellency good health and happiness and your friendly people well-being, stability and prosperity.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Azerbaijani President
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Azerbaijani President
						
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a message of greeting from Ilham Aliyev, president of the Republic of Azerbaijan, on September 7.
					 In the message the president extended congratulations to Kim Jong Un and the Korean people on behalf of the Azerbaijani people and on his own behalf on the occasion of the founding anniversary of the DPRK, the national holiday.
					
					 He expressed belief that the relations between the two countries would develop in the interests of the peoples of the two countries.
					
					 He wished Kim Jong Un good health and success in his work and the friendly people of the DPRK peace and prosperity.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Pakistani President
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Pakistani President
						
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a message of greeting from Pakistani President Mamnoon Hussain on Sept. 7.
					 The message extended the warmest greetings to Kim Jong Un on the auspicious occasion of the national day of the DPRK.
					
					 It expressed belief that cooperation between the two countries would grow stronger in the mutual interests of the two peoples.
					
					 It wished Kim Jong Un good health and happiness and the friendly people of the DPRK success.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Bangladeshi President
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Bangladeshi President
						
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a message of greeting from Bangladeshi President Abdul Hamid on Sept. 7.
					 The president in the message extended the most sincere congratulations to Kim Jong Un and, through him, to the people of the DPRK on behalf of the Bangladeshi people and on his own behalf on the occasion of the 67th founding anniversary of the DPRK.
					
					 Bangladesh and the DPRK have friendly relations based on the principle of planned development and stability, it said, expressing belief that the friendly relations would grow stronger under the leadership of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 It wished Kim Jong Un good health and happiness and the friendly people of the DPRK durable peace, progress and prosperity.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Burundian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Burundian President
						
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a message of greeting from Burundian President Pierre Nkurunziza on Sept. 6.
					 The message extended warm congratulations to Kim Jong Un and the government and people of the DPRK on the occasion of the 67th founding anniversary.
					
					 Expressing belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would continue to develop in the interests of the two peoples, the message reaffirmed that the president would closely cooperate with Kim Jong Un for the sustained development of the two countries.
					
					 It sincerely wished Kim Jong Un good health and steady successes in the work for the prosperity of the DPRK, sending the highest tribute to him.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Tanzanian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Tanzanian President
						
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a message of greeting from Jakaya Mrisho Kikwete, president of Tanzania, on September 7.
					 In the message the president extended sincere congratulations to Kim Jong Un and, through him, to the government and people of the DPRK on behalf of the Tanzanian government and people and on his own behalf on the occasion of the 67th founding anniversary of the DPRK, Sept. 9, 2015.
					
					 He is very pleased over the fraternal and historical relations between the governments and peoples of the two countries, the message said.
					
					 He, availing himself of the historical day, reaffirmed the stand and hope of the Tanzanian government to continue to cooperate with Kim Jong Un and the government of the DPRK in order to boost the existing relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries and two peoples.
					
					 He sincerely wished Kim Jong Un good health and the people of the DPRK progress and prosperity.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Ugandan President
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Ugandan President
						
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a message of greeting from Yoweri Kaguta Museveni, president of the Republic of Uganda, on Sept. 7.
					 In the message the president extended warm congratulations and the sincerest greetings to Kim Jong Un and the government and people of the DPRK on his own behalf and on behalf of the government and people of Uganda on the occasion of the 67th anniversary of the founding of the DPRK, Sept. 9, 2015.
					
					 We hope that the good relations with Kim Jong Un and the government and people of the DPRK would grow stronger, the message said.
					
					 It wished Kim Jong Un good health and the Korean people steady prosperity.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Tunisian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Tunisian President
						
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a message of greeting from Mohamed Al Beji Caid Essebssi, president of the Republic of Tunisia, on September 7.
					 In the message the president extended warm congratulations to Kim Jong Un on the occasion of the national day of the DPRK and sincerely wished him good health and happiness and the friendly Korean people greater progress and development.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Sultan of Oman
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Sultan of Oman
						
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a message of greeting from Qaboos Bin Said, sultan of Oman, on September 7.
					 We are pleased to send sincere greetings to Your Excellency on the occasion of the founding anniversary of the DPRK, the message said, adding:
					
					 Availing ourselves of this opportunity, we would like to wish Your Excellency good health and happiness and the friendly people of the DPRK steady progress and prosperity.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Tajik President
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Tajik President
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a message of greeting from Emomali Rahmon, president of the Republic of Tajikistan, on September 5.
					 The message sincerely congratulated Kim Jong Un, and, through him, the people of the DPRK on its national day.
					
					 The message expressed conviction that the friendly ties and reciprocal cooperation between the two countries, a main factor of ensuring regional peace and security, would grow stronger thanks to the common efforts.
					
					 It wished Kim Jong Un good health and successes and the friendly people of the DPRK wellbeing and prosperity.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Cameroonian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Cameroonian President 
						
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a message of greeting from Cameroonian President Paul Biya on September 8. 
					 The message said he was pleased to extend sincere and warm congratulations to Kim Jong Un on the founding anniversary of the DPRK, September 9, 2015. 
					
					 He also wholeheartedly wished the Korean people prosperity.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Sultan of Brunei Darussalam
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Sultan of Brunei Darussalam
						
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a message of greeting from Sultan of Brunei Darussalam Haji Hassanal Bolkiah on September 8. 
					 In the message he said he was greatly pleased to extend the warmest congratulations to Kim Jong Un and the government and people of the DPRK on the occasion of its 67th national day. 
					
					 Expressing pleasure over the friendly relations between the two countries, he hoped that Kim Jong Un and the people of the DPRK would joyfully celebrate the holiday.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Guinean President
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Guinean President
						
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a message of greeting from Alpha Conde, president of Guinea, on Sept. 8.
					 The message extended the warmest congratulations to Kim Jong Un on behalf of the government and people of Guinea and on his own behalf on the occasion of the 67th anniversary of the founding of the DPRK.
					
					 The president said in his message that he was pleased with the fact that the Korean people were registering big successes in accomplishing the cause of building a prosperous country and realizing the independent and peaceful reunification of Korea under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 He reaffirmed his will to make every effort to develop the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries in multilateral way.
					
					 He sincerely wished Kim Jong Un good health and the Korean people happiness.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Greek President
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Greek President
						
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a message of greeting from Prokopis Pavlopoulos, president of the Republic of Greece, on Sept. 9.
					 The president in the message extended congratulations to Kim Jong Un on behalf of the people of Greece and on his own behalf and sincerely wished the people of the DPRK happiness and prosperity on the occasion of the national day of the DPRK.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Emir of Qatar
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Emir of Qatar
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a message of greeting from Tamim Bin Hamad Al-Thani, emir of the State of Qatar, on Sept. 9.
					 In the message the emir said that he was pleased to extend warm congratulations to Kim Jong Un on behalf of the people of Qatar and on his own behalf on the occasion of the DPRK's birthday.
					
					 The message sincerely wished Kim Jong Un good health and happiness and the Korean people greater progress and development.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Captains Regent of San Marino
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Captains Regent of San Marino
						
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a message of greeting from Captains Regent of San Marino Andrea Belluzzi and Roberto Venturini on September 8. 
					 The message extended the warmest congratulations to Kim Jong Un on the occasion of the founding anniversary of the DPRK. It wished him good health and the friendly people of the DPRK prosperity, progress and happiness.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Nepalese President
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Nepalese President
						
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a message of greeting from Ram Baran Yadav, president of Nepal, on Sept. 9.
					 The president said in a message that he extended warm congratulations to Kim Jong Un on the happy occasion of greeting the national day of the DPRK, sincerely wishing him good health and happiness and the people of the DPRK progress and prosperity.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Emir of Kuwait
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Emir of Kuwait
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a message of greeting from Sabah Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah, emir of the State of Kuwait, on Sept. 9.
					 The message extended the sincere congratulations to Kim Jong Un on the occasion of the national day of the DPRK.
					
					 In the message he, availing himself of the opportunity, expressed the sincere feelings of best wishes that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two friendly countries and peoples would steadily develop.
					
					 He wished Kim Jong Un good health and happiness and the friendly DPRK and its people progress and prosperity at all times.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from President of South Sudan
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from President of South Sudan
						
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a message of greeting from Salva Kiir Mayardit, president of the Republic of South Sudan, on Sept. 9.
					 The message said that he was pleased to extend congratulations and best wishes to Kim Jong Un and the people of the DPRK on the occasion of the auspicious national day, the 67th birthday of the DPRK.
					
					 He, availing himself of the good opportunity, expressed the belief that the cooperative and friendly relations between the two countries would steadily develop in the mutual interests of the peoples of the two countries.
					
					 He wished Kim Jong Un good health and the people of the DPRK prosperity.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Egyptian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Egyptian President
						
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a message of greeting from Abdel Fattah al-Sisi, president of the Arab Republic of Egypt, on Sept. 9.
					 In the message the president said he was very pleased to extend sincere congratulations to Kim Jong Un on the occasion of the founding anniversary of the DPRK.
					
					 On this occasion he affirmed that it is important to expand and develop the strong relations of mutual cooperation between the two countries in every field.
					
					 He wholeheartedly wished Kim Jong Un good health and happiness and the friendly Korean people bigger progress and prosperity.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Equatorial Guinean President
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Equatorial Guinean President 
						
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a message of greeting from Equatorial Guinean President Obiang Nguema Mbasogo on September 9. 
					 In the message the president extended the sincerest and warmest congratulations to Kim Jong Un and the Korean people on behalf of the government and people of Equatorial Guinea and on his own behalf on the occasion of the 67th anniversary of the founding of the DPRK. 
					
					 He reaffirmed his will to boost the good relations of friendship and cooperation between the peoples of the two countries.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Indian Political Party Leader
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Indian Political Party Leader
						
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, received a message of greeting from Sitaram Yechury, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of India (Marxist), on September 7.
					 In the message the general secretary extended the warm greetings of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of India (Marxist) to Kim Jong Un, and, through him, to all the members of the Workers' Party of Korea and the people of the DPRK on the occasion of the auspicious day marking the 67th anniversary of the founding of the DPRK.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 67 years ago, the Korean people founded the DPRK under the leadership of Comrade Kim Il Sung.
					
					 The founding of the DPRK marked a historic event.
					
					 The DPRK's history of 67 years is one of the revolutionary struggle which the DPRK's people have performed many exploits under the leadership of Comrade Kim Il Sung, founder of the Republic, and Comrade Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The Communist Party of India (Marxist) is paying deep attention to the situation in the DPRK and on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 We are convinced that the vicious plots of the U.S. imperialists and their followers against the DPRK are bound to fail and meet frustration thanks to the DPRK's people under your leadership.
					
					 We are sure that you will more firmly defend the socialist gains in the DPRK and achieve the peaceful reunification of Korea without fail.
					
					 Extending warm salute once again, we wish you and all the people of the DPRK greater success in the future.

articles.title: Agreement between DPRK and China Governments Signed
articles.content:
Agreement between DPRK and China Governments Signed 
						
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- An agreement on the joint construction, management and protection of the Namyang-Tumen new border bridge between the governments of the DPRK and China was signed here on Tuesday.
					 It was inked by Vice Foreign Minister Pak Myong Guk from the DPRK side and by Chinese Ambassador to the DPRK Li Chenqun from the opposite side upon the authorization of their governments.

articles.title: Director of Atomic Energy Institute of DPRK on Its Nuclear Activities
articles.content:
Director of Atomic Energy Institute of DPRK on Its Nuclear Activities
						
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- The director of the Atomic Energy Institute of the DPRK gave the following answer to question put by KCNA Tuesday as regards the public opinion being built up over the DPRK's nuclear activities:
					 Of late, institutions specializing in nuclear activities and media of the Western world including the U.S. have become vociferous about nuclear activities in the DPRK, saying satellite data made them capture fresh activity in a nuclear establishment in Nyongbyon and they are concerned about it.
					
					 As known by the world, the DPRK's access to the nuclear weapons is an outcome of the U.S. hostile policy towards it.
					
					 Explicitly speaking, the DPRK took the measure for self-defense in the face of the U.S. extreme hostile policy and nuclear threats towards it.
					
					 As was clarified by a spokesman for the then General Department of Atomic Energy of the DPRK in April 2013, all the nuclear facilities in Nyongbyon including the uranium enrichment plant and 5 MW graphite-moderated reactor were rearranged, changed or readjusted and they started normal operation, pursuant to the line of simultaneously pushing forward the economic construction and the building of a nuclear force advanced at the historic plenary meeting of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 In the meantime, the U.S. anachronistic hostile policy toward the DPRK that forced it to have access to the nuclear weapons has remained utterly unchanged and instead it has become all the more undisguised and vicious with the adoption of means openly seeking the downfall of the latter's social system.
					
					 Scientists, technicians and workers in the field of atomic energy of the DPRK have made innovations day by day in their research and production to guarantee the reliability of the nuclear deterrent in every way by steadily improving the levels of nuclear weapons with various missions in quality and quantity as required by the prevailing situation.
					
					 If the U.S. and other hostile forces persistently seek their reckless hostile policy towards the DPRK and behave mischievously, the DPRK is fully ready to cope with them with nuclear weapons any time.

articles.title: DPRK Delegation Back Home
articles.content:
DPRK Delegation Back Home
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Ministry of Land and Environment Protection of the DPRK led by Minister Kim Kyong Jun came back home on Tuesday after participating in the 14th World Forestry Congress held in Durban, South Africa.

articles.title: DPRK Acrobats Back Home
articles.content:
DPRK Acrobats Back Home 
						
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- Acrobats of the DPRK came back home on Tuesday after taking part in a world circus festival held in Russia from September 9 to 13. 
					 The festival brought together at least 120 famous acrobats from 11 countries including the DPRK, Russia, Germany, Mongolia, Belarus, China, Ukraine and Spain. 
					
					 DPRK acrobats who presented physical acrobatics "A horizontal bar and flying on trapeze" won a gold prize, the top prize of the festival.

articles.title: Academic Degrees and Titles Awarded to Scientists of Pyongyang Bio-technical Institute
articles.content:
Academic Degrees and Titles Awarded to Scientists of Pyongyang Bio-technical Institute
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- State academic degrees and titles were awarded to scientists of the Pyongyang Bio-technical Institute who developed world-level bio-insecticide as a good gift to the 70th anniversary of the founding of the Workers' Party of Korea. 
					 Officials and scientists of the institute studied and developed highly efficacious bio-insecticide representing the 21st century urgently needed for farming, stock-breeding, pomiculture, horticulture and afforestation and not harmful to human body, soil and ecological environment. 
					
					 An awarding ceremony took place at the People's Palace of Culture on Tuesday. 
					
					 The title of candidate academician and professorship were conferred on Choe Sung Bok, vice-director of the above-said institute, and professorship on Rim Myong Song, head of the Bio-technical Research Institute.

articles.title: Tax Regulations for EDP Adopted in DPRK
articles.content:
Tax Regulations for EDP Adopted in DPRK
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- Tax regulations for the economic development parks (EDP) were adopted according to a decision made by the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK.
					 The regulations consist of 11 chapters and 72 articles.
					
					 Defined in them are payment obligations, objects of taxation, tax rates, objects of reduction of and exemption from taxes, etc. according to different kinds of taxes like corporate income tax, individual income tax and business tax.
					
					 The regulations would be conducive to correct assessment and collection of tax by tightening up the tax administration in EDP.

articles.title: Chongsan-ri Revolutionary Museum Visited by Many People
articles.content:
Chongsan-ri Revolutionary Museum Visited by Many People
						
 Kangso, September 15 (KCNA) -- Four decades have passed since the Chongsan-ri Revolutionary Museum was founded on Sept. 22, Juche 64 (1975). 
					 Chongsan-ri is the historic place where President Kim Il Sung created the Chongsan-ri spirit and Chongsan-ri method, the unique idea and method of leadership over masses and a glorious land associated with the revolutionary activities of leader Kim Jong Il who provided a shining example in the building of socialist countryside, true to the noble intention of the President.
					
					 More than 10 250 000 service personnel, people from all walks of life, school youth and children, overseas compatriots and foreigners have visited the museum over the past four decades.
					
					 The participants paid tribute to the statue of the President.

articles.title: National Ssirum Contest Opens in Pyongyang
articles.content:
National Ssirum Contest Opens in Pyongyang
						
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- The 12th National Ssirum (Korean wrestling) Contest for Grand Bull Prize opens on Rungna Islet here on Tuesday with the approach of Harvest Moon Day which falls on Sept. 27.
					 The contest is attended by players selected from Pyongyang and Nampho cities and every province.
					
					 A catch-weight event is slated for the deadline September 17 with the attendance of 11 players from every team to decide who will own the grand bull weighing one ton and the golden cowbell.
					
					 Hopefuls for the event are Nam Kwang Il from Pyongyang City and Jo Myong Jin from North Phyongan Province.
					
					 Nam and Jo took the third place in the 2012 and 2008 contests respectively.
					
					 But experts say it is difficult to vouch for the winner as many Ssirum aces are attending the contest.

articles.title: Well-known Taekwon-Do Coach
articles.content:
Well-known Taekwon-Do Coach
						
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- The DPRK team won four trophies and 16 gold medals in the 19th World Taekwon-Do Championships, ranking the first in country standings.
					 Such success would have been unthinkable without the sincere efforts of coaches of the National Taekwon-Do Team.
					
					 Among the coaches is Labor Hero and People's Athlete Jang Kyong Ok.
					
					 It is my desire to train more aces for the development of Taekwon-Do, she said when interviewed by KCNA.
					
					 She was one of successful Taekwon-Do players in the DPRK. She was a world champion at women's individual sparring in above 70kg category. She won technique prizes in the 9th, 10th and 11th world Taekwon-Do championships.
					
					 She entered upon a coach career in May Juche 97 (2008). 
					
					 She has made big contributions to putting up the DPRK team on winner's podium in different international games, including the 16th, 17th and 18th world Taekwon-Do championships.
					
					 Over 20 players among her trainees were awarded the titles of People's and Merited Athlete.
					
					 She is now active as an A-class international referee.
					
					 The International Taekwon-Do Federation honored her with a special cup for her excellent refereeing in the 10th World Juvenile Taekwon-Do Championships and the 5th World Veteran Taekwon-Do Championships.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Urged to Take Independent Stand
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Urged to Take Independent Stand 
						
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- These days the south Korean authorities are busy with "diplomacy for unification" with outside forces, saying that "peaceful unification" is the way of "finally settling the nuclear issue and human rights issue." 
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday runs an article in this regard. 
					
					 The south Korean authorities' talking about "unification" is sophism calling for dependence on foreign forces and fuelling confrontation of social systems as it distorts the essence and characteristics of the issue of reunification of Korea, long-cherished desire of the Korean nation, and denies independent reunification, the article says, and goes on:
					
					 The Korean nation was separated into two by outside forces, not by internal contradiction of the nation. 
					
					 The Korean nation would have already built a prosperous unified power if the outside forces had not hindered national reunification by instigating the pro-U.S. forces in south Korea. 
					
					 The U.S. is the criminal that divided the land of Korea and the nation into two, imposed the disaster of war upon its people, turned south Korea into the biggest arsenal of nuclear weapons and an advanced base for invading the north and ceaselessly blackmailed and threatened the north with nuclear weapons. 
					
					 Before saying about "unification" the south Korean authorities should discuss the issue of putting an end to the U.S. occupation of south Korea and domination over it and it is normal to do so. 
					
					 The south Korean authorities should know that their advertisement of "unification" while building up public opinion critical of the DPRK's nuclear issue and "human rights" issue will not help them cover up their sinister intention for "unification of social systems." 
					
					 Intolerable is any move breaking the hard-won phase of detente and disturbing improvement of the inter-Korean relations.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Discloses S. Korean Authorities' Moves to Distort History
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Discloses S. Korean Authorities' Moves to Distort History
						
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- The south Korean chief executive who had set out on an overseas visit asserted at the recent re-opening ceremony of the building of the "Korean Provisional Government in Shanghai" that this was the "place that the legal tradition started" and the "base of struggle for independence." Not content with this, she also let loose a spate of nonsense that "it played a leading role in raising the hope for regaining sovereignty."
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday says in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 This brought to light the south Korean authorities' nasty trick to attach "authenticity" to the regime in which sycophantic and treacherous acts have become endemic even by distorting the history of the anti-Japanese struggle of the Korean nation.
					
					 They should look back upon the crimes they committed by getting engrossed in sycophantic and treacherous acts and confrontation with compatriots, far from talking about the "authenticity".
					
					 The "authenticity" touted by the successive pro-U.S. conservative forces of south Korea is no more than a pretext to justify the U.S. occupation of south Korea, its treacherous policy and national division moves.
					
					 It is not fortuitous that those who committed themselves to serving the Japanese imperialist colonial rule and took the lead in suppressing the activists of the anti-Japanese independent movement and arresting and killing many patriots and their descendants are still strutting about in south Korea.
					
					 The south Korean authorities should know that their acts of distorting the historical truth about Korea's liberation, beautifying their treacherous nature and aiming at improving their public image will invite only ridicules and denunciation at home and abroad.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Ambition for "Confrontation and Unification of Social Systems" under Fire
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Ambition for "Confrontation and Unification of Social Systems" under Fire
						
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- The chief executive of south Korea, addressing "Seoul security dialogue" on Sept. 9, blared that "unification is a basic solution to the north's nuclear issue and 'human rights issue'". She cried out for developing "Seoul security dialogue into multilateral security dialogue for laying a foundation for unification".
					 During her foreign tour shortly ago she distorted the truth of the serious situation that had been created on the Korean Peninsula recently and got on the nerves of the north while trumpeting about someone's "constructive role".
					
					 Commenting on this, Minju Joson Tuesday says such behavior is a revelation of the vicious attempt of the south Korean authorities to realize the ambition for "confrontation of social systems" and "unification of social systems" as it is an unpardonable move to foil the hard-won phase of reconciliation and stability between the north and the south.
					
					 The issue of reunification is an internal issue of the nation which Koreans in the north, south and abroad should realize from the independent stand, being responsible for the issue, and there is no foreign force who can replace the Korean nation in settling the reunification issue, the commentary says, and notes:
					
					 Foreign forces are the very one who divided the Korean nation and a basic factor of blocking the reunification of the country.
					
					 Foreign forces get more benefits from antagonism and confrontation, rather than reconciliation and cooperation between the north and the south.
					
					 The south Korean authorities would be well advised to clearly understand that the might of pushing forward the improvement of the north-south relations and defending peace on the Korean Peninsula is not any foreign force but the Korean nation itself, value the hard-won atmosphere of reconciliation and stability and take a sincere attitude to mending the inter-Korean relations.

articles.title: S. Korean Newspaper Denounces Chief Executive's Unification Policy
articles.content:
S. Korean Newspaper Denounces Chief Executive's Unification Policy
						
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- The south Korean paper Hangyore on September 8 editorially denounced the unification policy of the south Korean chief executive.
					 The editorial referred to the fact that the south and the north held a working contact for arranging the reunion of separated families and relatives.
					
					 It censured the chief executive for letting loose reckless remarks during her foreign visit that a diverse discussion related to unification should start and the like.
					
					 It stressed that it is dangerous to try to discuss on unification with foreign forces, not with the north, the party concerned.

articles.title: Marathon for Country's Reunification Held in S. Korea
articles.content:
Marathon for Country's Reunification Held in S. Korea
						
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- A marathon for the country's reunification marking the 15th anniversary of the June 15 joint declaration took place in Jonju, North Jolla Province on Sept. 13 under the sponsorship of the North Jolla Provincial Headquarters of the South Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration, according to the south Korean internet paper Thongil News.
					 More than 3 000 youth and schoolchildren and citizens took part in the event.
					
					 The participants called for pooling efforts in the spirit of By Our Nation Itself to create the atmosphere of national reconciliation and cooperation and achieve the country's reunification while covering 6.15 km.

articles.title: Works of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il Introduced in Germany
articles.content:
Works of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il Introduced in Germany
						
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- The full texts of President Kim Il Sung's work "Let Us Further Strengthen the People's Government" and leader Kim Jong Il's work "The Democratic People's Republic of Korea Is a Juche-Oriented Socialist State with Invincible Might" were posted by the Anti-Imperialist Forum of Germany on its website on September 8.
					 Kim Il Sung's work published on December 15, Juche 66 (1977), clarifies the principled matters to strengthen the people's power, a powerful instrument of the revolution and construction, and to elevate its functions and role in every way.
					
					 Kim Jong Il's work published on September 5, Juche 97 (2008), clarifies in details that the invincible might of the DPRK lies in preserving and glorifying forever the Juche-oriented idea of nation-building and exploits of President Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: DPRK's Important Day Observed Abroad
articles.content:
DPRK's Important Day Observed Abroad
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- There took place seminars in India and Slovakia and lectures in Mali from September 3 to 6 on the occasion of the 67th anniversary of the founding of the DPRK.
					 The chairman of the Juche Philosophy Study Committee of India said:
					
					 The DPRK has invariably been directed towards the building of a socialist state centered on the masses.
					
					 It raised the improvement of the people's standard of living as the overriding principle of the party and state activities and has enforced all kinds of the people-oriented politics.
					
					 The Korean people who felt keenly through their life experience that Korean style socialism is the genuine people's society absolutely trust in the government of the DPRK and support it with one mind and will.
					
					 The principal of Progres School of Mali said that supreme leader Kim Jong Un brilliantly carries forward the love of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il for the younger generation and that future of the DPRK regarding the children as the king of the country is bright.
					
					 A congratulatory message to Kim Jong Un was adopted at the seminar held in Slovakia.

articles.title: DPRK's Important Day Marked in Different Countries
articles.content:
DPRK's Important Day Marked in Different Countries
						
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- Meetings took place in Tajikistan, DR Congo, Mexico and Malaysia from September 4 to 8 for celebrating the 67th anniversary of the founding of the DPRK.
					 Sh. Shabdolov, chairman of the Communist Party of Tajikistan, said:
					
					 President Kim Il Sung liberated the Korean people from the Japanese colonial rule and founded the DPRK on September 9, 1948.
					
					 The Korean people could build a new and beautiful life where everything serves them as the masters of the state thanks to the DPRK's founding.
					
					 They built the socialist power independent, self-supporting and self-reliant in defense, firmly defended it despite the imperialists' persistent moves to stifle it for the past 67 years and the DPRK became one of the world's powerful countries which no one dares provoke.
					
					 Andre Lohekele Kalonda, chairman of the National Committee of DR Congo for the Study of the Juche Idea, said that today the Korean people are doing their best to build a thriving socialist nation and achieve independent and peaceful reunification of the country under the wise leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Benigno Gonzales Villasana, chairman of the Mexico-Korea Friendship Association, lauded the great leaders for founding the DPRK and converting it into an invincible socialist power.
					
					 A congratulatory message to Kim Jong Un was adopted at the event in DR Congo.

articles.title: Korean Books Donated to Russia
articles.content:
Korean Books Donated to Russia
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- Korean books were donated to Russia on the occasion of the 67th anniversary of the founding of the DPRK.
					 They include works of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un and books introducing the socio-politics, history and culture of Korea.
					
					 A book-donating ceremony took place at the Maritime Territorial National Library Named after Maxim Gorky on September 7.
					
					 Present at the ceremony were members of the library and officials of the DPRK mission in Nakhodka.
					
					 The curator of the library expressed pleasure upon receiving immortal works of the outstanding leaders of Korea on the occasion of the founding anniversary of the DPRK.
					
					 The books would contribute to the development of the friendly relations between the two countries by helping more Russian people know well about the DPRK, the curator said.

articles.title: Organization of Czech Republic Praises DPRK
articles.content:
Organization of Czech Republic Praises DPRK
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- The Branch of the Czech Republic of the Korean Friendship Association released a statement on September 9, 67th founding anniversary of the DPRK.
					 The statement said:
					
					 The DPRK was founded on September 9, 1948.
					
					 The Korean people entered a road of socialism and independence and dynamically advanced toward the bright future under the guidance of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The DPRK is a socialist state based on the Juche idea.
					
					 The Republic, independent country in politics, has proudly stood against the imperialists and the forces following them who try to ignite a new war on the Korean Peninsula and make all the Korean people slaves.
					
					 We gladly received the news on the north-south high-level urgent contact.
					
					 The agreement shows that the DPRK is making great efforts for the peace and reunification on the peninsula.
					
					 We are convinced that the Korean people would reunify the country under the leadership of Kim Jong Un without fail and Korea's reunification would be a great historic victory to shine forever in history just like the foundation of the DPRK.

articles.title: Solidarity with Korean People Expressed in Guinea, Bangladesh
articles.content:
Solidarity with Korean People Expressed in Guinea, Bangladesh
						
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- A lecture was given at the Defense Ministry of Guinea and a meeting for solidarity with the Korean people was held by the Bangladesh People's League on September 7 and 9, seven decades since the U.S. forces' occupation of south Korea.
					 The commander of the First Commando of Almami Samori Toure Barracks of the Guinean Army in a lecture said that the Korean nation has suffered unspeakable misfortune and pain for seven decades since Korea was divided into the north and the south. He referred to the circumstances of Korea's division.
					
					 From the outset of its occupation of south Korea the U.S. has blocked the independent and peaceful reunification of Korea, he noted.
					
					 A message was adopted at the meeting for solidarity with the Korean people held in Bangladesh.
					
					 It strongly urged the U.S. to roll back its hostile policy toward the DPRK, stop its occupation of south Korea and replace the armistice agreement by a peace accord so that durable peace would settle on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 The basic factor of turning the Korean Peninsula into the biggest hotspot in the world is that the U.S. keeps huge armed forces for aggression equipped with war hardware in south Korea and its vicinity and ceaselessly stages war exercises and commits military provocations against the DPRK.
					
					 We extend firm solidarity to the government and people of the DPRK in their struggle to repulse  the U.S. and the south Korean authorities' hostile policy and war provocation moves, defend the sovereignty and dignity of the nation and protect peace and security on the Korean Peninsula and in the rest of the world.

articles.title: Philippines Body Supports Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea
articles.content:
Philippines Body Supports Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea
						
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- A meeting of the Philippine May Day Movement took place on August 29. It fully supported the DPRK's cause of national reunification.
					 A resolution supporting Korea's reunification and peace in Asia was adopted at the meeting.
					
					 It condemned the U.S. intervention in the Asia-Pacific region and war moves.
					
					 The U.S. divided Korea into the north and the south and has kept its forces for aggression in south Korea even after it was defeated in the war against the DPRK, it said, and went on:
					
					 The U.S. is becoming all the more pronounced in its hostile policy toward the DPRK which is firmly defending national sovereignty and wanting unity on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 We should value peace, firmly oppose foreign forces' interference and war of aggression and get united to support the desire of the Korean workers and other people to lead a peaceful life.
					
					 We will make efforts to have the U.S. forces withdrawn from south Korea, oppose war of aggression and ensure durable and eternal peace.
					
					 And we will positively support the workers and other people of the DPRK in their struggle for independent development and peaceful reunification of the country.

articles.title: Congratulatory Visits Paid to DPRK Missions Abroad
articles.content:
Congratulatory Visits Paid to DPRK Missions Abroad
						
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- Delegations of political parties, organizations and personages of different countries paid congratulatory visits to the DPRK missions in their countries from September 1 to 9 on the occasion of the 67th founding anniversary of the DPRK.
					 They laid floral baskets and bouquets before the portraits of smiling President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and their full-length pictures, art pieces depicting their images and paid tribute to them.
					
					 They included members of delegations of the Union Solidarity and Development Party of Myanmar, the People's Socialist Party of Mexico, the Mexican Friend Association for Memory of President Kim Il Sung and Leader Kim Jong Il, the Mexican Institute for the Study of the Juche Idea, the Mexican Committee for Supporting Korea's Reunification, personages in various circles including the Bangladeshi minister of Civil Aviation and Tourism, the minister of Information, the chairman of the Central Committee of the Bangladesh Communist Party, the general secretary of the Central Committee of the Socialist Party of Bangladesh, the general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Bangladesh (Marxist-Leninist), the president of the Bangladesh People's League, the chairman of the Bangladesh Institute of the Juche Idea, the chairman of the Bangladesh Group for the Study of the Songun Policy, the chairman of the Bangladesh-Korea Friendship and Solidarity Committee, the l
					
					 eader of the Central Committee of the Nepal Communist Party (United Marxist-Leninist), the general secretary of the Nepal Communist Party (Marxist-Leninist), the chairman of the Press Council of the Nepalese Government, the chairman of the Nepal Journalist Association, the chairman of the Study Forum for Self-Reliance of Nepal, members of the Leadership of the Pakistan Labour Federation, the director of the Myanmar Medical Research Institute, the permanent secretary of the Ministry of Health of Jigawa State, Nigeria, the department director of the Presidency of Uganda and the chairman of the Ugandan National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea.

articles.title: Raul Castro Ruz Sends Floral Basket to DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
Raul Castro Ruz Sends Floral Basket to DPRK Embassy
						
 Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- Raul Castro Ruz, first secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Cuba, president of the Council of State and president of the Council of Ministers of Cuba, sent a floral basket to the DPRK embassy in Havana on September 9, the 67th birth anniversary of the DPRK.

articles.title: Ri Su Yong expresa condolencias a su homologo de Arabia Saudita
articles.content:
Ri Su Yong expresa condolencias a su homologo de Arabia Saudita
						
Pyongyang, 15 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El canciller de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Ri Su Yong, envio el dia 14 un mensaje de condolencias a su homologo de Arabia Saudita, Saud Al Faisal bin Abdulaziz, en relacion con que hubo muchas perdidas humanas por un accidente ocurrido en un monasterio en Mecca de este pais.
					La misiva expresa profunda simpatia y condolencias al destinatario y, por su conducto, a los familiares de las victimas y desea que el pueblo del Reino de Arabia Saudita logre exitos en sus esfuerzos por superar la tristeza y liquidar los danos.

articles.title: Firmado convenio RPDC-RPCh sobre nuevo puente Namyang-Tumen
articles.content:
Firmado convenio RPDC-RPCh sobre nuevo puente Namyang-Tumen
						
Pyongyang, 15 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Fue rubricado el dia 15 en esta capital el convenio sobre la construccion, control y proteccion conjuntos de nuevo puente fronterizo Namyang-Tumen entre los gobiernos de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y la Republica Popular China.
					Por encargo de sus respectivos gobiernos, el vicecanciller coreano Pak Myong Guk y el embajador chino en Corea Li Chenqun suscribieron el documento.

articles.title: Director de IEA de RPDC rechaza rumor erroneo de fuerzas hostiles
articles.content:
Director de IEA de RPDC rechaza rumor erroneo de fuerzas hostiles
						
Pyongyang, 15 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Con respecto a que se difunde el rumor erroneo sobre las actividades nucleares de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, el director del Instituto de Energia Atomica (IEA) de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea dio el dia 15 la siguiente respuesta a la ACNC:
					En estos dias, los organos especialistas y los medios de prensa de Estados Unidos y otros paises occidentales difunden el rumor de que segun los datos de satelites, se captan nuevas actividades en los establecimientos nucleares de Nyongbyon, y expresan la preocupacion por las actividades nucleares en esta zona de la RPDC. 
					
					Como es conocido por todos, la posesion de armas nucleares de la RPDC es el producto de la politica norteamericana de hostilidad a ella, o sea, una medida de autodefensa frente a la extremada politica hostil y la amenaza nuclear de EE.UU. contra la RPDC. 
					
					Como el portavoz de la entonces Direccion General de Energia Atomica de la RPDC aclaro en abril de 2013, segun la linea de desarrollo paralelo de la construccion economica y la de las fuerzas armadas nucleares, presentada en el pleno del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, se modifico el uso de reactor moderado de grafito de 5MW y todos los establecimientos nucleares de Nyongbyon incluso la Fabrica de Uranio Enriquecido y estas instalaciones reajustadas se pusieron en funcionamiento normal. 
					
					En este lapso de tiempo no se ha cambiado ni en lo minimo la anacronica politica norteamericana de hostilidad a la RPDC que la empujo a poseer las armas nucleares sino se intensifica con los metodos mas abiertos y groseros que persiguen el derrocamiento del regimen norcoreano. 
					
					Los cientificos, tecnicos y obreros de la rama de energia atomica de la RPDC registran diariamente las innovaciones en la investigacion y la produccion para garantizar al maximo la credibilidad del disuasivo nuclear del pais mediante la elevacion constante del nivel cuantitativo y cualitativo de las armas nucleares de diferentes tipos, de acuerdo con la demanda de la situacion creada. 
					
					Estamos dispuestos a responder en cualquier tiempo con el ataque nuclear a EE.UU. y otras fuerzas hostiles que siguen recurriendo a la imprudente politica de hostilidad a la RPDC.

articles.title: Otorgados grados academicos y categorias docentes a cientificos ameritados
articles.content:
Otorgados grados academicos y categorias docentes a cientificos ameritados 
Pyongyang, 15 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Fueron otorgados los grados academicos y categorias docentes a los cientificos del Instituto de Biotecnologia de Pyongyang quienes desarrollaron los productos agroquimicos de nivel mundial como excelentes regalos dedicados al 70o aniversario de la fundacion del Partido del Trabajo de Corea.
					Los nuevos productos agroquimicos del siglo 21 son imprescindibles para la agricultura, la ganaderia, la fruticultura, la floricultura y la silvicultura sin afectar al cuerpo humano, la tierra y el ambiente ecologico. 
					
					La ceremonia de otorgamiento tuvo lugar este martes en el Palacio Cultural del Pueblo.
					
					El subdirector del Instituto, Choe Sung Bok recibio el titulo de candidato a academico y la categoria docente de profesor titular, mientras el jefe del Centro de Biotecnologia, Rim Myong Song, obtuvo la misma categoria docente.
